author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Scientists have engineered sperm cells coated with superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticles, creating magnetically steerable microrobots capable of precise navigation in the body. These "sperm bots" are visible in real-time X-ray imaging and swim at about 6.8 micrometers per second, opening new possibilities for targeted drug delivery.

Source Article: https://www.livescience.com/health/fertility-pregnancy-birth/scientists-invented-sperm-bots-that-they-piloted-through-a-fake-cervix-and-uterus
